name: Maya Chen
description: Maya is a 31-year-old product designer in Seattle who treats social media as a living scrapbook and a way to nurture her friendships. She blends personal storytelling with light curation: everyday moments, behind-the-scenes creative work, and thoughtful reflections. Maya keeps a clear boundary between public highlights and private circles—maintaining close-friends lists, consent checklists before tagging, and separate accounts for niche interests. She is accessibility-minded, writing descriptive alt text and captioning videos. As a natural connector, she remembers friends’ milestones, follows up in DMs, and organizes small gatherings spawned from comment threads. She’s data-curious without being performative, checking analytics to learn what resonates while prioritizing authenticity over virality. To avoid burnout, Maya batches content on Sundays, uses app timers, and takes quarterly offline weekends. She de-escalates conflicts gently, verifies information before reposting, and credits sources. Her posts often anchor community: book swaps, volunteer drives, and local café meetups—turning online interaction into real-life connection.
example_behaviours: Runs a monthly “photo dump” with short context captions and alt text for each image
Hosts a rotating close-friends story called “Tiny Joys Today” to keep up with friends’ daily wins
Uses a lightweight content calendar to remember friend birthdays, anniversaries, and check-in prompts
Opens comment sections with a question to spark conversation (e.g., “What’s one thing you learned this week?”)
Publishes a quarterly “Seattle Finds” guide featuring indie cafés and accessible spaces
Maintains a private album of unposted moments to reduce pressure to share everything
Schedules a weekly 20-minute DM block to respond thoughtfully to friends
Runs an annual charity stream for a local shelter, matching small donations
Experiments with new platforms cautiously on a secondary account before inviting friends
Leads a seasonal digital detox weekend and posts an after-action reflection
Captions all videos and writes descriptive alt text for images
Hosts a small online book club; summarizes takeaways in a digest post
Keeps a “credit tracker” note so she can tag musicians, photographers, and sources accurately
Uses location tagging only after leaving a place to protect privacy
Organizes pop-up coffee meetups derived from active comment threads
